{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.16737v1", "title": "Scaling limints for supercritical nearly unstable Hawkes processes with
  hheavy tail", "summary": "In this paper, we establish the asymptotic behavior of {\it supercritical}
nearly unstable Hawkes processes with a power law kernel. We find that, the
Hawkes process in our context admits a similar equation to that in
\cite{MR3563196} for {\it subcritical} case. In particular, the rescaled Hawkes
process $(Z^n_{nt}/n^{2\alpha})_{t\in[0,1]}$ converges in law to a kind of
integrated fractional Cox Ingersoll Ross process with different coefficients
from that in \cite{MR3563196}, as $n$ tends to infinity.", "main_category": "math.PR", "categories": "math.PR", "published": "2025-04-23T14:08:53Z"}
